cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSW of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: tracking WNW along or just north of eastern–central Cuba, then turning northwest toward the Florida Keys and south-central Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys / extreme South Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Haiti northern coast, southeastern Bahamas, multiple Cuban provinces
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect – only watches issued
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola north coast, southeastern and central Bahamas, eastern-central Cuba, Florida Keys and southern Florida peninsula
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed near Puerto Rico in Advisory #10 table
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (heaviest rain now forecast west of Puerto Rico)
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional outer-band gusts; sustained tropical-storm-force winds no longer expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for San Juan as core remains well west
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of leftover showers possible, but widespread heavy rain threat has shifted west
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized flash-flood risk in previously saturated areas, otherwise none significant
